RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy runs on the "Windows" group that is maintained by the 1.1 OS Classification\Windows sub-policy. All detected Windows devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
When Windows devices are not manageable by CounterACT the remaining sub-policies use various available attributes to separate possible corporate machines needing maintenance from suspected guests and known unauthorized windows devices.
Managed machines are passed to compliance policies via the "Managed Windows Devices" group.
Unmanaged machines can be restricted/forced to Guest Registration control policies by inserting the appropriate add to group action once control policies are in place and have been fully vetted.
RULE.NAME: (Windows Enterprise Manageability)

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Machines managed via the Host Property Scanner Domain Credentials are added the "Managed Windows Devices" group.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Domain Managed

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This rule identifies unmanaged machines that have been manually approved and exempted by a CounterACT administrator via the "Exempt-Approved Windows Devices" group.
This should be used when a known quantity Windows machine must remain on the network but cannot be managed (technical or political justification).
INNER_RULE.NAME: Manually Approved Windows Devices

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Machines that are using the correct NetBIOS domain/workgroup name, but are not manageable via domain credentials and have not been verified as actual Domain members will be identified by this policy.
These can include: - Machines with broken Domain accounts (need to be re-joined - Machines impersonating the domain name, but are in a Workgroup. - Misconfigured lab or test machines
These should be investigated and legitimate machines remediated.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Corp NetBIOS Domain

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This sub-policy identifies misc. NetBIOS domain and workgroup names that have been discovered on the network.
Authorized Domain names may need to be separated from this rule in a similar fashion to the Corp NetBIOS Domain Name sub-policy.
This allows for tracking a baseline of machines in non-standard Domains that must exist on the network.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Misc NetBIOS Domain Names

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
The remaining Windows devices that have not provided enough properties for host Clarification or events detected on the SPAN interface.
This is typically the one of the first places to begin enforcement/remediation actions.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Unknown Windows Machines
Firewall Agent Installed, but Service Not Running
Patching Agent Installed, but Service Not Running

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true on the endpoint: 'Wired AutoConfig' service is not running When this condition is true, the endpoint is considered: Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: 'Wired AutoConfig' Service Not Running

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if the following is true for the supplicant installed on the endpoint: 'Enable IEEE 802.1X authentication' configuration is not enabled When this condition is true, the endpoint is considered: Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: 802.1X Authentication Not Enabled

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Verifies if both of the following are true for the supplicant installed on the endpoint: Network authentication method is not 'PEAP' Network authentication method is not 'Smart Card or other certificate' When both of these conditions are true, the endpoint is considered: Not ready for 802.1X authentication
INNER_RULE.NAME: Required Authentication Method Not Selected

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: When the inspected endpoint does not match any of the preceding policy sub-rules, the endpoint is considered: Ready for 802.1X authentication.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Endpoint Is Ready
Agent Installed but NOT Recently Checked In

PARAM.NAME: message
PARAM.VALUE: Your administrator requires that your CrowdStrike Falcon Sensor (Agent) is operational before accessing this network. Contact the help desk at 555-555-5555

PARAM.NAME: message
PARAM.VALUE: Your administrator requires that your CrowdStrike Falcon Sensor (Agent) is operational before accessing this network. Contact the help desk at 555-555-5555

INNER_RULE.NAME: ITSM Agent Installed, but Service Not Running

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: AV is running and Defs are up to date
INNER_RULE.NAME: AV Running and Up to Date

CONDITION.LABEL: Windows Antivirus Update Date :Value : 360 Safe, AVG, Active Virus Shield, AhnLab, Avira, BitDefender, CA eTrust, Carbon Black, ClamAV, Comodo, CrowdStrike, ESET NOD32, EstSoft, F-Secure, FortiClient, GData, Hauri, K7, Kaspersky, LANDesk, Lightspeed, Malwarebytes, McAfee, Microsoft ForeFront / System Center Endpoint Protection, Microsoft Security Essentials, New Technology Wave, PC Ziggy, Palo Alto, Panda, Rising, Sophos, Symantec, Trend Micro, Vipre, Webroot, avast, eScan

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: AV is running but definitions are older than 1 week.
INNER_RULE.NAME: AV Running BUT Defs older than 2 Weeks

PARAM.NAME: message

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: AntiVirus is installed BUT Not running.
INNER_RULE.NAME: AV Installed BUT NOT Running

message
subject
PARAM.VALUE: CounterACT: No antivirus detected event at {ip}

INNER_RULE.NAME: Proxy / Browsing Security Controls Bypass Running

PARAM.VALUE: 3 High Accounts Domain Admin logged in

INNER_RULE.NAME: Member of Domain Users Logged On

Disk Encryption Installed and Not Encrypted

PARAM.NAME: group-name
PARAM.VALUE: id:1653531238844616128;name:Endpoints with Encryption Installed But Not Encrypted

PARAM.NAME: message
message

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Plugin Name:Security Policy Templates Display Name:VR Apache Log4j Name:VR Apache Log4j Version:21.0.12 Comments:Multiple; CVE-2021-44228; IT; IoT;> - DO NOT EDIT ABOVE THIS LINE -
This sub-rule runs a script on endpoints, and matches endpoints that the script identifes as Vulnerable per CVE 2021-44228. Default actions place these endpoints in the 'VR Apache log4j - Vulnerable' group, and give them the label CVE 2021-44228 Vulnerable for tracking. Customize your response with additional actions on these endponts.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Vulnerable

CONDITION.LABEL: Windows Expected Script Result Command or Script file:fs_test_log4j_detector_Windows.bat, Run Interactive:false
Linux Expected Script Result (DEPRECATED) Run script as root user on endpoint:0, Command or Script File:fs_test_log4j_detector_Linux.sh

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Plugin Name:Security Policy Templates Display Name:VR Apache Log4j Name:VR Apache Log4j Version:21.0.12 Comments:Multiple; CVE-2021-44228; IT; IoT;> - DO NOT EDIT ABOVE THIS LINE -
This sub-rule runs a script on endpoints, and matches endpoints that the script identifes as Potentially Vulnerable per CVE 2021-44228. Default actions place these endpoints in the 'VR Apache log4j - Potentially Vulnerable' group, and give them the label CVE 2021-44228 Potentially Vulnerable for tracking. Customize your response with additional actions on these endpoints.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Potentially Vulnerable

CONDITION.LABEL: Windows Expected Script Result Command or Script file:fs_test_log4j_detector_Windows.bat, Run Interactive:false
Linux Expected Script Result (DEPRECATED) Run script as root user on endpoint:0, Command or Script File:fs_test_log4j_detector_Linux.sh

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Plugin Name:Security Policy Templates Display Name:VR Apache Log4j Name:VR Apache Log4j Version:21.0.12 Comments:Multiple; CVE-2021-44228; IT; IoT;> - DO NOT EDIT ABOVE THIS LINE -
This sub-rule runs a script on endpoints, and matches endpoints which run log4j releases 2.15.x-2.17.x. These endpoints may be affected by related vulnerabilities discovered after CVE-2021-44228. Default actions place these endpoints in the 'VR Apache Log4j - Possibly Affected by Variants' group, and give them the label Apache Log4j-2 Possibly Affected by Variants for tracking. Customize your response with additional actions on these endponts.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Possibly Affected by Variants

CONDITION.LABEL: Windows Expected Script Result Command or Script file:fs_test_log4j_detector_Windows.bat, Run Interactive:false
Linux Expected Script Result (DEPRECATED) Run script as root user on endpoint:0, Command or Script File:fs_test_log4j_detector_Linux.sh

PARAM.NAME: label
PARAM.VALUE: Apache Log4j-2 Possibly Affected by Variants

PARAM.NAME: group-name
PARAM.VALUE: id:-1341926156808627618;name:VR Apache Log4j - Possibly Affected by Variants

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Plugin Name:Security Policy Templates Display Name:VR Apache Log4j Name:VR Apache Log4j Version:21.0.12 Comments:Multiple; CVE-2021-44228; IT; IoT;> - DO NOT EDIT ABOVE THIS LINE -
This sub-rule runs a script on endpoints, and matches endpoints that the script identifies as Not Vulnerable. By default, no actions are applied to these endpoints.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Not Vulnerable

CONDITION.LABEL: Windows Expected Script Result Command or Script file:fs_test_log4j_detector_Windows.bat, Run Interactive:false
Linux Expected Script Result (DEPRECATED) Run script as root user on endpoint:0, Command or Script File:fs_test_log4j_detector_Linux.sh

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Plugin Name:Security Policy Templates Display Name:VR Apache Log4j Name:VR Apache Log4j Version:21.0.12 Comments:Multiple; CVE-2021-44228; IT; IoT;> - DO NOT EDIT ABOVE THIS LINE -
This sub-rule matches endpoints that did not match previous sub-rules. The evaluation script used by other sub-rules may not have run successfully on these endpoints.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Unknown
